title: Blackwater Rail Trail Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Witham, ducks by Mike Faherty, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Witham, ducks by the river near the start of the route.

images.title: Stuart Vickers / Bridge over the old Witham to Maldon railway
images.caption: Bridge over the old Witham to Maldon railway

images.title: St Peter's Church, Wickham Bishops, Essex by Peter Stack, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Peter's Church, Wickham Bishops, Essex

images.title: Langford Weir by Paul Franks, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Langford Weir

images.title: John Myers / Chandlers Quay, Maldon
images.caption: Chandlers Quay, Maldon. Looking across the Chelmer from this upmarket apartment/mooring complex to the flour mills on the north bank.

images.title: Elms Farm Park by Glyn Baker, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Elms Farm Park. This pretty park is located on the western side of the trail, just south of Langford.

images.title: Bob Jones / Pontoons on the River Chelmer
images.caption: Pontoons on the River Chelmer in Maldon. Just downstream from Fullbridge Wharf, these wooden pontoons allow houseboats to be moored alongside.

description: This is a nice, easy cycle or walk along a disused railway line between Witham and Maldon in Essex. The route passes through the pretty village of Langford and includes views of the River Blackwater and a riverside section along the River Chelmer into Maldon. Here you can enjoy fine views of the Blackwater Estuary at the Marine Lake in Promenade Park. You can also pick up the Chelmer and Blackwater Navigation Canal and enjoy easy waterside walking or cycling along the towpath. To extend your walking you could try the Witham River Walk which heads south along the River Brain to the Whetmead Nature Reserve. Here you can see the confluence of the River Blackwater and the River Brain and look out for a variety of interesting flora and fauna.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: In the worthy village of Wickham Bishops there's The Mitre Loungs for a pit stop. There's good quality food and a pretty garden at this pleasant pub. You can find them at postcode CM8 3NN. The Green Man in nearby Little Braxted is another option. The old pub overlooks the village green and includes oak beams & log fires. Outside there's a lovely garden area to relax in. You can find them at postcode CM8 3LB for your sat navs.
